thread.title: Grovedale woman offers free trip ... if your name is Ben McCartney
thread.title_full: Grovedale woman offers free trip ... if your name is Ben McCartney | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals | | The Advertiser

author: COURTNEY CRANE
title: Grovedale woman offers free trip ... if your name is Ben McCartney
text:
SHE’S got a ticket to fly for a boy by the name of McCartney.
But it’s not Paul she’s after; it needs to be Ben McCartney.
When Deakin nursing student Juliet Swanepoel booked two tickets to the Sunshine Coast, she imagined surprising her then-boyfriend with a relaxing and romantic three-day getaway.
But their relationship has broken up and she’s now on the hunt for a man with the same name to share in a fun-filled adventure.
“I wanted to bring a friend with me instead, but it was a Jetstar fare where I was able to take a friend for free and I couldn’t change the name on the ticket,” Ms Swanepoel said. “I thought, ‘why let it go to waste’?”
The 36-year-old Zimbabwe-born adventurer, who lives in Grovedale, plans to stay in Noosa and hopes to find another man called Ben McCartney who is keen for a free plane ticket.
The return trip is booked for October 24 to 27, though accommodation has not yet been sorted.
“If he’s not creepy, he can share accommodation if he wants,” Ms Swanepoel said.
“I want to drink margaritas, get a tan, go out, dance, have fun and basically imagine I’m in Cancun,” she said.
“I’m hoping to find someone spontaneous, because going on a trip with a stranger who just happens to have a ticket is a pretty random thing to do.
“I’d really just like to offer the ticket to someone with the same name. They can have a partner or maybe just want to make a new friend. I’m more than happy for them to stay somewhere else, too. I’d just like someone to get a free ticket and not let it go to waste.”
To contact Ms Swanepoel email sudevidasi@gmail.com.
AN ICY WAY TO START THE DAY
Originally published as Free trip if you share name with ex
